content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"^(?:\s*`{3,})?\s*julia\b\s*(?:\|.*)?\s*(\S+)\s*$"mx

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Iterate over each line in the markdown document
    for line in split(md, '\n')
        # If a line matches the Julia code block pattern
        m = match(julia_code_block, line)
        if m !== nothing
            # Get the content of the code block
            content = strip(m[1])
            # Append the content to the extracted code
            extracted_code *= "\n" * content
        else
            # If a line does not match, add it to the end of the code (if we have any)
            extracted_code *= line
        end
    end

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the extracted code
    return strip(extracted_code)
end
```
